title: News & Updates
text: Check out the latest news and major updates from our lab!

title: The 2025 Korean Geography Conference
text: At the 2025 Korean Geography Conference held on June 27‚Äì28, our lab‚Äôs master‚Äôs degree candidate, Hyemin, presented her thesis titled ‚ÄúRegionalization of the Seoul Metropolitan Area Using Graph Transformer-Based Representation Learning and Spatially Constrained Clustering.‚Äù Congratulations to her, and we wish her all the best after graduation!

title: Projects
text:
Duration: 2025(ongoing)
Principal Investigator: Professor Sang-Il Lee
Title: ‚ÄúDevelopment of Interactive National Atlas of Korea‚Äù
Project Description: This project aims to produce an interactive version of the National Atlas of Korea to be exhibited at ICC 2025 in collaboration with the National Geographic Information Institute (NGII). Our lab is responsible for selecting content to be included in the atlas, acquiring and preprocessing the relevant data, and making key decisions regarding the implementation of individual map components.

title: Projects
text:
Completed Projects

Projects Completed in 2025

Joint Project with National Geographic Information Institute(NGII)
Title: ‚ÄúDevelopment of Interactive Contents for Comprehensive Edition of National Atlas of Korea‚Äù(Pilot Project)
Duration: October 2024 - January 2025
Key Outcomes: 11 Interactive Maps and Plots
National Atlas of Korea(In English) (To view the interactive content, please switch the site language to Korean)


AIEDAP(AI EDucation Alliace & Policy lab) Project for Social Studies Eduation
Title: ‚ÄúDevelopment of a Programming-based Instructional Program to Enhance Digital Competency of Pre-service Social Studies Teachers‚Äù
Duration: March 2024 - March 2025
Key Outcomes: Lee, S.-I., Go, B., Koh, J., Kim, S., Kim, W., & Lim, C. (2025). Development of a programming-based instructional program to enhance digital competency of pre-service social studies teachers. Journal of Educational Technology, 41(1), 79‚Äì109.
